intro: Phaca jucunda, commonly known as the small-flowered phaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like. Phaca jucunda is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to arid conditions.
